I'm going ga-ga over this salad. Very nice!

Saved to Delicious.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: I'm glad you like it, and thanks for the saves and stumbles guy! That stuff really helps.

comments.author: Abby @ mangerlaville
comments.content: Wow, this looks amazing. With the last bits of summer left, you made a stunner salad. I like the addition of watermelon and the fresh herbs.

comments.author: Dicentra
comments.content: That looks awesome. I'd swap mushrooms for the eggplant though. The orange muscat vinegar from TJ's is to die for!! Yum!

comments.author: Tofu Mom
comments.content: The salad looks delicious!!! I do love a good spiked watermelon once in a while too... way too many memories of teenage summertimes from (VERY!!) long ago there....

comments.author: Megan
comments.content:
We faked this entirely, left out the lettuce, subbed mango for watermelon, added mushrooms, and didn't grill (used a grill pan on the stove), and it still came out wonderfully.  Very inspirational, and a really great salad that works well as leftovers (if you leave out the lettuce, nothing to get soggy!).

Thank you!!

comments.author: Lael
comments.content: This sounds great! I made a greek style salad with watermelon in it recently and was so pleased with the result (http://onehungrysoul.blogspot.com/2008/09/ingenious.html). I had never had watermelon in that context, but it just seems to belong now, just as easily as it does on a hot summer picnic in big, juicy wedges. I'll bookmark this sure.

comments.author: Sophie
comments.content: I've seen watermelon used in savory foods, but have yet to try it like this.  Sounds delish!  I really like that oil-free dressing, very cool idea.

comments.author: robynn
comments.content:
this is a really great salad! I love your site (just happily stumbled upon it) and I made this salad several times - throwing in different fruits like mangos, peaches etc. it doesn't really matter - it all works with the lovely dressing.
Since I'm living in Europe, there's no Trader Joe available here, but your dressing is wonderful!
Thanks!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Thanks Robyn! I'm glad you reminded me of it, I haven't made that yet this summer. Good suggestions for alternate fruits too.

comments.author: MaryAnn
comments.content: I made this salad for a recent dinner party and everyone loved the combination of eggplant, watermelon and lime dressing.  Will definitely make again.  It looks so special but easy to make.

comments.author: Julia
comments.content: I never tried grilled eggplant with melon though grilled eggplant is one of my favorite. But I would like to try this out and recommend if I love it. Thanks :)
